intro: Gaudichaudia niedenzua, commonly known as the red-flowered gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Gaudichaudia niedenzua is often found in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia.
